channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7910] Dont use reflection for security
item.description: security.User class uses reflection so that HBase can work with older Hadoop's not having security. Now that we require 1.x, or 0.23 or 2.x, all Hadoop versions have security code. We can get rid of most of the User class.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Agree with getting rid of the reflection, so long as we keep the User class as a wrapper around UserGroupInformation to protect ourselves from future changes. This usage is deeply engrained enough in the HBase code that I think having our own abstraction makes sense.

so long as we keep the User class as a wrapper around UserGroupInformation to protect ourselves from future changes.

Agreed. We can just remove the reflection, and keep User's interface as it is.

Removing reflection from UserGroupInformation (IBM JVM vs SUN JVM login section) will break hadoop on any platforms that SUN/Oracle JVM is not supported - i.e. POWERFPC and S390x. The real solution will be to develop hadoop security component that is independent of platform and JVM vendor.

Amir Sanjar This issue does not imply any changes to UserGroupInformation, nor could it. That is a Hadoop class and would be a Hadoop issue.

HBase has its own User class as a wrapper around UserGroupInformation. This class uses reflection to ride over backwards incompatible API changes to UserGroupInformation between pre-secure Hadoop and secure Hadoop. Since HBase 0.95 requires a version of Hadoop already supporting security, we can eliminate reflection in the User class that was previously used to check for the API changes.
Gary, thanks for clarification..
moving out of 0.95.
No patch, unscheduling from 0.98
Enis Soztutar - do you mind if I try and take this one on?
Mike Drob sure go ahead.
I wasn't able to remove the reflective calls for org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.TokenUtil, but I'm not sure if that was in scope for this JIRA.

+1

Let's see what HadooQA says for a build against Hadoop 2.

Tested with 0.98 and -Dhadoop.profile=1.0.

+1 for branch-1.

In http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#basic.prerequisites, the 0.94 entries for Hadoop < 1.0.3 are 'X' in the supported Hadoop version matrix. We can remove reflection for secure 0.94 as well. Attached a patch for 0.94 that is the 0.98 version of User.java after Mike's changes are applied. Compilation using both Hadoop 1 and 2 profiles succeeds. Security unit tests pass locally. Sources in security/ are unconditionally included in 0.94 builds these days, we'd have compilation issues for ancient Hadoop versions there anyway. Ping Lars Hofhansl

Ping stack for 0.96, change could go in there too.

Will commit to 0.94+ if I get an ack for that version. 0.98+ otherwise.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12656794/HBASE-7910-0.94.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12656794

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/10128//console

This message is automatically generated.

Hmm... It's certainly nice to get rid of all that annoying code. On the other hand there are no visible problems (I know of) that stem from this - other than ugly unnecessary code.

I'd say we leave it the way it is in 0.94. If there are good reasons let's get it in. I guess that makes me -0 or +0.

On the other hand there are no visible problems (I know of) that stem from this - other than ugly unnecessary code

Yes, there are performance concerns when security is active, see HBASE-11444
Oh, that's important and was overlooked - 0.94 patch incorporates HBASE-11444 - if committed, remember to update fixed version there too
+1 then. Thanks Andrew Purtell!
Committed to 0.94+

FAILURE: Integrated in hbase-0.96 #411 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/hbase-0.96/411/)
HBASE-7910 Dont use reflection for security (Mike Drob) (apurtell: rev e85a6d86d97a984438b5369f0139430883467a79)

  • hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/User.java

The 0.96 build is complaining:

[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 

[ERROR] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/hbase-0.96/hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/User.java:[253,28] error: cannot find symbol

Looks like a patch misapplication. Committing an addendum.
Committed addendum. Cherry picking back from master missed a hunk due to HBASE-11444
